title: Join Us
text:
We welcome collaborators and applicants interested in AI-enabled multi-hazard forecasting, early warning systems, and decision support.
Our work combines machine learning, physical modelling, and uncertainty analysis to support risk-informed decisions for natural hazards.

title: Join Us
text:
Research themes

Multi-hazard and cascading event modelling
Machine learning for hazard detection and forecasting
Uncertainty-aware prediction and evaluation
End-to-end warning pipelines and decision support
Open tools, reproducible science, and real-world impact

title: Join Us
text:
Opportunities

PhD / MSc students
Applicants with a strong quantitative background (e.g. machine learning, statistics, physics, engineering, or geoscience) and an interest in hazards and resilience.


Postdoctoral researchers
Researchers with evidence of independent work, strong writing, and a clear research agenda aligned with the group’s themes.
We are happy to support applications to competitive postdoctoral fellowships, including:

  
    
      Marie Skłodowska-Curie Postdoctoral Fellowships
    
  
  
    
      Leverhulme Early Career Fellowships
    
  
  
    
      1951 Research Fellowships
    
  
  
    
      Newton International Fellowships
    
  
  
    
      Royal Society or UKRI-funded schemes
    
    (where applicable)
  



Research software / engineering
Researchers with experience in machine learning tooling, data pipelines, and reproducible research.
